intro: Conostylis pauciflora subsp. euryrhipis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow leaf blades and distinctive floral morphology. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. This plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
